alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Schenectady (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, northwestern Albany, northeastern Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Central Bridge, or 12 miles northeast of Cobleskill, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rotterdam, Duanesburg, Delanson, Rotterdam Junction, Central Bridge, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Princetown, Esperance, Duane, Hoffmans, Rockwell Corners, Harding Crossing, Gifford, Market Corners, Quaker Street, Schonowe, Hutchinson Crossing, Oak Ridge, Mariaville Lake and Beukendaal. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 23 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25a and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 2b. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Schenectady
